meanings.definition: The act of applying pressure to something.
meanings.sent1: She used firm pressings to flatten the dough.
meanings.sent2: The machine made loud pressings as it squeezed the juice out of the fruit.
meanings.sent3: The cat's gentle pressings on my lap were a sign of affection.
meanings.sent4: The pressings of the crowd against the barrier reminded me of a powerful force.
meanings.sent5: The pressings of the massage therapist on my shoulders were incredibly relaxing.

meanings.definition: Items that have been pressed or squeezed.
meanings.sent1: The laundry was full of clean pressings neatly folded in the drawer.
meanings.sent2: The book had beautiful pressings of flowers preserved between its pages.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret recipe called for special pressings of herbs for extra flavor.
meanings.sent4: The pressings of the collector's coins were displayed in a glass case.
meanings.sent5: The pressings of the vinyl record created a warm, nostalgic sound.

meanings.definition: The process of producing something by pressing.
meanings.sent1: The factory's pressings of metal sheets were used to make car parts.
meanings.sent2: The artist's unique pressings of clay resulted in stunning pottery.
meanings.sent3: The pressings of the printer created copies of the important document.
meanings.sent4: The pressings of the keys on the piano produced a beautiful melody.
meanings.sent5: The pressings of the grapes in the winery led to the production of fine wine.
